The pages for this adventure are available to download at "Dragonkingdoms.co.uk" and yahoo's group site "HeroQuest-Adventures" for free. You do need to join the group to access the file's section where they are stored. The photo section of this site will allow you to read the story and look at the maps to see if this game is something you would like to play. Your adventure awaits!

125086.name: Buddy Bones
125086.description:
"Welcome to Buddy Bones, the first turn-based dominoes app that allows you to play against your buddies. Buddy Bones was designed to bring that same sense of camaraderie and competition once found around kitchen and park bench tables, to your favorite Apple mobile device."

Source: The Game Website.

125087.name: Call Of Gods EX
125087.description:
User Summary

In Call of Gods EX you will feel the wrath of the gods. You have to gather your army and try to left mark in history. The game features distinctive maps, 11 heroes of Greek mythology, thousands of equipment, achievements and PvP fights.

125088.name: Adventure 6: Resurrection – Return of the Witch Lord 2 (fan expansion for HeroQuest)
125088.description:
In this second set of adventures, we continue the stories that were created in the expansions series created by Milton Bradley.
In this adventure Mentor discovers that Queen Kessandria and Skulmar are planing to resurrect the Witch Lord. Can you get there in time to stop them?
This adventure has new spells for both sides and monster cards were created for all the cool monsters that were introduced in the original story. There is a page for making new doors. This game will take a little work to create but is well worth the effort.
The pages for this adventure are available to download at "Dragonkingdoms.co.uk" and yahoo's group site "HeroQuest-Adventures" for free. You do need to join the group to access the file's section where they are stored. The photo section of this site will allow you to read the story and look at the maps to see if this game is something you would like to play. Your adventure awaits!

125089.name: The Cultist-Monks of the Abbey Inn
125089.description:
From Introduction:

This encounter is designed to introduce the characters to a beholder cult. It does not pit them directly against a beholder, although it can be adjusted to do so if the GM wishes. Instead, it puts them in conflict with the cultists who serve the Dominion of the Poisoned Eye.

The encounter can take place in a city, but it works best if the abbey is the only accommodation in miles, probably in a hamlet or along an isolated road. The monks of a monastery have set up an inn to feed travelers in the area. They charge 5 sp per night, which includes lodging, dinner, and breakfast.

The inn is separated from the abbey by a thick wooden door. The monks prepare and serve the meals. They are dressed in thick woolen cloaks, but most keep their hoods down inside the inn. They have shaven heads and a variety of racial backgrounds. The food is simple, but hot and filling. Ale and wine are also available, although each mug or glass is 5 cp extra. The sleeping rooms are on the second floor above the common dining room, which is separated from the abbey by a thick wooden door.

The Cultist-Monks of the Abbey Inn is a free encounter that introduces characters to the eyekin, beholder cultists, and vast conspiracies ruled by the eye tyrants found in The Complete Guide to Beholders.

125090.name: Ego: The Adult Game of Communication
125090.description:
The fun filled thought provoking discussion generated between players demonstrates the qualities of being unique and being human. To express your opinion of a subjects qualities (player being evaluated), each analyst (all remaining players) must dieal their "opinionators" to displa a most/least or hes/no answer. Characteristics shown on Ego cards require your opinion of what the player is most and least like. When a statement is read from an Alter Ego card, your yes or no opinion is required of what you think the subject will say. There are no intrinsically right or wrong answers, but gives everyone a chance to express their opinions.

Playing The Game: To select the first subject, an Ego card is drawn by each player. The playwer whose characteristics begin with the letter nearest teh beginning of the alphabet becomes the first subject. The subject then collets all Ego cards drawn and places them face up in the Tripper so that each space contains at least one card. All remaining players and the subject then express their pinions of the subject by dialing their opinionators to mach the most/least ccolor combination under the Ego cards int he tripper.

Example: The three Ego cards displayed read generous, expressive and shy. If a player perceives the subject as being more expressive than shy or generous then the player would dial their opinionator to reveal the word most in the color that matches the color under the expressive ego card in the tripper. If the player percieves the subject as being less shy than generous then the player would dial their opinionator to reveal the word least in the color matching the "shy" ego card under the tripper making sure that the Most color already is revealed at the same time. When all players are ready they turn over their opinionators to reveal their opinions.

How to Score: The subject moves forward one square for each analyst opinion that matches his, plus one of his own. Players whose opinions do not match any other player move back one square. Players cannot move further back than the beginner square. Player whose opinions match one or more players remain where they are and are not penalized even if they do not match the subject's opinion. After scoring the player on the subject's left becomes the next subject adn the next session is played.

Winning the Game: Play continues with a new subject being evaluated after each session is complete. The player who reaches the winners circle first is the winner.

125092.name: Wipper
125092.description:
From the box:

¿Aquatic animals beginning with D or I? Being faster than the rest of the family, Kevin hits the beep and activates the sound & light referee. Then he have 3 seconds to give his answer: "Dolphin!" He wins! Kevin discards a card and the game continues

It's easy!. Simply find a word beginning with a particular letter on one of the 66 entertaining topics. Only your own quick thinking and coolness will allow you the victory. To increase the variety and interest of the game, we propose two levels: 33 cards with easy and distracting issues to Play with the children and most difficult 33 tokens for the adults.

125093.name: Protodimension (Issue 12 - Spring 2012)
125093.description:
Contents


AnglerFish by Neil A. Armstrong - A short story.
Beasties of the Great White North by Tim Bisaillon - A Dark Conspiracy (1st Edition) creature.
Left 4 Dead by Jason Paul McCartan - A Savage Worlds horror survival scenario.
Get Around Town by Lee Williams - A Dark Conspiracy (1st Edition) scenario seed.
Dust by Kevin O'Neill - A location for Dark Conspiracy (1st Edition).
Now Batting by Lee Williams - An interview with Angus Abranson.
Not in Kansas Anymore - A fictional short story by Tad Kelson III.
Paid in Blood by James Mullen - A description of a new mini-rpg.
The Gepard M6 Lynx Anti-Materiel Rifle by Kevin O'Neill - A new weapon for Dark Conspiracy (1st Edition).
Good Dog by Captain Obvious - Fiction
Second Century, New Millenium by Lee Williams - A new weapon for Dark Conspiracy (1st Edition).
Ampney Down by Lindan Dunham - A scenario for Call of Cthulhu (2nd - 6th Edition).

125094.description:
Glory of the Three Kingdoms is a living deck-building game (LDBG) in which each player takes a role leading an allegiance in the Three Kingdoms period and battles for total victory or for victory points.

As in most deck-building games, player acquire additional cards to add to their decks. In GOTK, player may acquire cards depicting heroes, military, strategy, items, etc., and some cards provide victory points for endgame scoring. Unlike other games of this type, GOTK has a battle phase during which each player secretly deploys military cards (foot soldiers, pikemen, calvary and archers) and battles for Glory. The victor takes a glory token from the defeated player and a free card in the neutral zone. The victor may also capture and recruit the defeated general – or have him beheaded.

When two out of four card decks are depleted, the game ends and the player with the most victory points wins. However, if one allegiance acquired six or more Tiger Tally or all of opponent's glory tokens, the game ends immediately and the allegiance wins.

The first battle theme of GOTK is Guandu, the first major battle in the Three Kingdoms period. The Guandu Core Set, a two-player game, comes with Cao Cao and Yuan Shao allegiances. Lu Bu and Liu Bei allegiances will be available in a future three- and four-player expansion.
125094.name: Glory of the Three Kingdoms: Guandu Core Set

125095.name: Goofy Finds His Marbles
125095.description: This is a very simple game for kids 4 to 8. You simply spin the spinner and move your marble from the start line to the finish. If your spin causes you to land on another players marble you simply stop one space short of where your opponents marble is.

125096.name: Monsterheart Skins
125096.description:
User summary:

Standard character playbooks (character sheets with rules summaries) for Monsterhearts.

125097.name: Movies
125097.description: A game of mimic in which the players, playing in couples, must discern which movie his partner is representing. As they guess them correctly (or fail in doing so), they advance (or move back) their tokens, 'till someone reach the "best director" square to win the Oscar and the game. After that, all the players can vote who's been the best actor and award him other little Oscar.

180357.name: Core Worlds: Dice Tower Season 11 Kickstarter Promo

125099.description:
In Core Worlds: Galactic Orders – the first expansion to Core Worlds, the deck-building card game of intergalactic conquest – players begin to forge alliances with the six Galactic Orders, powerful organizations that have maintained their independence in the midst of a crumbling empire. These Orders consist of the Galactic Senate, the Science Guild, the Merchant Alliance, the Mining Coalition, the Order of Knighthood, and the Mystic Brotherhood. The Galactic Orders expansion focuses on these six independent organizations and their influence upon a galaxy at war.

Each Galactic Order is represented on the table by a large Galactic Order card that specifies the special power associated with that Order, and each player starts with 20 Faction Tokens that match the Faction symbols on their Starting Decks. Whenever a player deploys a Unit or plays a Tactic with a Galactic Order icon on it, he gets to place his Faction Token onto the corresponding Galactic Order card. Players must choose between leaving their Faction Tokens on the Galactic Order cards to score points at the end of the game, or removing their Faction Tokens in order to use the unique special powers associated with each Order.
125099.name: Core Worlds: Galactic Orders

125100.name: Pew Pew Land 2
125100.description:
Whimsical defense action just got better than ever! Download Pew Pew Land II & start planning, blasting, & defending your way to victory through one vibrant cartoon level after another! An explosion of color & action, defense gaming has never been more addicting!

Pew Pew Land II is the follow-up to Pew Pew Land, the critical and commercial smash hit that re-imagined the TD gaming genre on iOS. This game builds upon its predecessor in almost every way while still remaining true to the Pew Pew spirit that endeared legions of gamers to the original.

Source: The Developer Website.

125101.name: Lunar Racer
125101.description:
Strap on your moon boots and fire up your nitro boosters because the real space race is about to begin! Shoot, dodge, blast, and nitro boost your way through the solar circuit.

Source: The Developer Website.

125102.name: Yes, Master
125102.description:
Having successfully graduated from the Academy of Assistants, Igor entered the service in the castle of Evil Professor Garriarti, who does cruel tests and experiments on human beings wishing to conquer the world.

Idolizing Professor, the young apprentice works hard and tries every way to help his master. But one day, cleaning up the laboratory, Igor falls under the action of laser-machines - after the "injury" Igor’s life changes dramatically.

The young apprentice realized that all the things taking place in the castle are terrible, and that he himself was just one of the experiments of Professor. Not wanting to be a "guinea pig" any more Igor decides to stop Evil Professor Garriarti anyway and cast him out of the castle.

Watching the professor, Igor noticed that Garriarti loves to have things clean and tidy. The teacher has always chastised his assistant for keeping things in a mess, giving him extra assignments.

Based on this observation, the apprentice starts working on a plan "Exile", according to which Igor was going to irritate the professor until he himself did not leave the castle! In the course of the game you have to build a trap for the Evil Professor, moving items from one room of the castle to the others. For example, you can put a rat into the fridge or bring a terrible mess in the library, or just smear some ink on his teacher’s favorite painting!

However, you should remember that Igor can not turn up in front of Garriarti - the Evil Professor is looking for the rebellious pupil to punish him and to continue their vicious experiments.

Source: The Developer Website.

125103.name: Blockolicious
125103.description:
Blockolicious is a fast paced action arcade puzzle game for iOS where you squeeze Fruit Blocks into bursting Juice Bombs. Perform actions with each block color to extract flavored juice and energize your animal power-ups. Use your power-ups at key moments to boost your score. Play fast and well to benefit from streak bonus’ and multipliers. Test your skills on the weekly leaderboard with the support of Facebook Connect, Game Center and Crystal.

Source: The Game Website.

125104.name: Falleritus
125104.description:
An iOS physics-based indie game about a guy falling through the absence of reality, trying to hold onto sanity long enough to unlock the story of his life leading up to psychosis.

Source: The Game Website.

125105.name: Final Freeway
125105.description:
Final Freeway is an old-school pure arcade racer for iOS and Android OS. Floor the accelerator and whoosh by those safe family drivers!

The fun is back !

Source: The Developer Website.

125106.name: Scorched Monster
125106.description:
Scorch the monsters that randomly appear with your FLAME THROWER!

But WATCH YOUR STEP because evil spikes come out of the ground to stop you!

Scorched Monster is a fun new retro platform game with old school pixel art 80's style graphics for all to love!

To achieve ultimate victory, rank up from Rookie to SCORCH MASTER!!!

Source: The Developer Website.

125107.description:
Octopunk is a tile placement exploration game set in the near future, transgenic octopi have been tasked with building a human habitat on Europa's deep ocean floor. Players pick one of five different uplifted octopi and search 36 exploration tiles looking for the resources to build the dome while dodging the very dangerous dragon jellyfish. the humans will arrive in only four years and if the mission is not complete everyone loses. The Game consists of twenty five eight sided Ocean Floor zones in the spaces between the octagonal zones square exploration tiles are placed face down, they may contain either resources or hazards for the players to discover.
If the players have completed building the human habitat and surrounded it with four defense turrets (before the humans arrive) then points are scored by resources collected, structures built, and hazards defeated.
125107.name: Octopunk

125108.name: Dogs of War: Legends of the Crushed Planes
125108.description:
Dogs of War is a wargame using 22mm miniatures to form together into squads that take to the battlefield and wage war on each other. The game has a rich history and setting with unique races and models. During each round of play, a player can move his or her squads, strike and shoot at enemy squads and even cast magic designed to help you and hinder allies. Various scenarios exist in the game that will define goals for the game, time limits and other details. There is even, in development, a campaign set of rules that will be designed directly into the core set of rules. Each race has it's own set of special rules and squad lists with attributed points values to make the game a "fair fight."

Play as one of several races for dominion and survival in the crushed planes. Play as the Ng'Awuthii, otherwise known as the Ng to foreign races, an advanced race of humanoids who possess technology far surpassing the technology of all other races combined. Or play as the talwart Tuskers, tribes of wise and savage nobility who use their heavy weaponry, tough skin and rending tusks to demolish their foes. Play as these, or several other races including the beautiful Eduran people who wield powerful magic and fight with inhuman grace, or the infamous Nameless, insect kin who travel above-ground in a pupal state which appear kin to dwarves of mythology or even the Kingdoms of Man.

125109.name: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

rpghonor.20103: 2012 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee

rpg.10737: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

rpgpodcastepisode.175599: Dungeon Crawl Classics: Perils of the Sunken City

125109.description:
From the publisher's website:


You're no hero. You're an adventurer: a reaver, a cutpurse, a heathen-slayer, a tight-lipped warlock guarding long-dead secrets. You seek gold and glory, winning it with sword and spell, caked in the blood and filth of the weak, the dark, the demons, and the vanquished. There are treasures to be won deep underneath, and you shall have them.


Return to the glory days of fantasy with the Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game. Adventure as 1974 intended you to, with modern rules grounded in the origins of sword & sorcery. Fast play, cryptic secrets, and a mysterious past await you: turn the page…

125110.name: Doom of the Savage Kings

rpg.10737: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

125110.description:
From the publisher's website:


Dungeon Crawl Classics #66.5:
Doom of the Savage Kings
A Level 1 Adventure

High above the windswept moors and darksome woods, the village of Hirot is under siege. Each night, as the sun sinks beneath the western mountains and the candles burn low, a devil-beast stalks the village streets, unleashing its savage fury on the living. From warlord to pauper, crone to child, no one is safe.

Defeating the immortal hound will require more than mere blades or even spells. To slay the beast, the characters must delve into the mysteries of the land and its Savage Kings. Only then, armed with relics forged from a bloody past, can the most cunning and courageous of adventurers challenge the hound of Hirot!

This adventure module is available exclusively by pre-ordering DCC RPG before it releases! The first 1,000 copies of DCC RPG will have this adventure module inserted as a free pre-order incentive. It is not available for sale separately.

125111.name: Yggdrasil for iPad
125111.description:
Ludonaute announces Yggdrasil for Ipad, its co-operative board game designed specifically for Ipad. Ygdrasil for Ipad features the Pierô’s wonderful artwork and the original game rules. You can play solo or in Pass & Play mode.

The Ipad application makes the game even easier to play, faster and addicting. You can play a game in half an hour, without be annoyed setting up the contents, nor putting them away, with a nice background music. In short, such happiness!

Like in the “cardboard” board game, you can adjust the difficulty level with the special cards and the number of Gods you play.

Yggdrasil for Ipad supports Game Center. We have entered a scoring system, which allows you to compare the scores of all your games and if you deserve it, to enter the Hall of Fame. You can unlock gradually Ragnarök cards and the 3 promo Gods Vidar, Frigg and Balder.

Bader, who is Balder (Baldr)? Baldr is a new God we offer you in Yggdrasil for Ipad. We told you a litle about him here. His power: for one action, you can score one victory point. Enough to break your records!

Source: The Developer Website.

125112.name: The Lost City
125112.description:
From the publisher's website:

Deep below Nordaleth Caldera sits the city of Des’gaeth. This old dwarven city was once their greatest city then the plagues came driving them from their homes. For a long time it has been lost, its streets choked with lava, monsters and the fanatics who refused to flee.

Now the city is being rediscovered. Stories of walls covered in joules and ancient relics fill adventures ears, those who have gotten out have other stories to tell. Some say an army is forming in the old city, other speak in hushed whispers about the city itself being alive.

125113.name: The Weeping Widow
125113.description:
From the publisher's website:

The Weeping Widow is the sort of tavern where a lot of trouble can be found in a short amount of time. It is run by a vindictive sailor’s widow who is out to hunt down the people she feels responsible for her husband’s death. To that end she will work with anyone and everyone who can help her. But her criminal connections and bribes to the city guard have not gone unnoticed and there are some lines she will not cross.

125114.name: The Orcs of Hermit's Island
125114.description:
From the publisher's website:

Once again we return to the Hermit’s Island, last time we were there we explored the Cursed Catacombs below the old monastery. Now we turn north to The Orc Camp and find that they have quite a different life from their continental kin. These orcs have passed through the lands of the dead and lived, they have found a new faith and may have some of them even have a destiny.
This issue touches on several other stories that have been told in earlier issues of Toys for the Sandbox. The cup of Folly first appeared in the Gambling Gryphon and more information on the orc druid war can be found in The Druids Grove.

125115.name: The Ice Merchant
125115.description:
From the publisher's website:

As the summer days grow longer and the temperature rises it is time to reach for a nice cool drink to make things more comfortable, before freezers and refrigeration this meant buying ice from an ice house. Ice-houses stored that had been cut from ponds during the winter or shipped from colder climates.

This week’s Toys for the Sandbox tells the story of Marcus, a former hireling turned merchant. This time out there was only room for 3 NPCs but one of them is a dragon with a score to settle. There is of course the map and flavor text describing the business and a whole bunch of hooks.

There is ecological devastation, forbidden love and a business rivalry that might be more than it seems.

125116.name: High Keep
125116.description:
From the publisher's website:

This week’s Toys for the Sandbox climbs the mountains to visit an elven keep crafted from a giant sugar pine. The keep guards a strategic pass that separates the elf lands from the orc territories. As the Druid/Orc War starts to heat up and the frost giants move further south the keep may find itself on the front lines.

Add to this a reclusive commander, a missing merchant and possibly even a defeated god the possibilities for adventure is almost unlimited. The High Keep offers up 18 plot hooks, 4 npcs a map of the keep and a bit of history. You also get a random rumor table for the region and a random encounter table.

125117.name: Dreck and Bother
125117.description:
From the publisher's website:

This week Toys for the Sandbox presents another in our ongoing series of inns, taverns, and pubs. This time it is nothing fancy just a small local pub owned by a feuding couple. What chance for adventure is there in a place like that? Well a simple thing like a few missing bottles of ale can lead to much more. As always there are plenty of adventure hooks and interesting people for your party to meet at the Dreck and Bother.

125118.name: The Abandoned Mine
125118.description:
From the publisher's website:

Despite all the changes going on this week everything you love about Toys for the Sandbox is still there. We have the all the people and all the possibilities and added more flavour text then before, we also throw in a few magic items because hey who does not like magic items. I would have them looked at before you use them though they may be cursed.

This week we delve into an abandoned mine that used to be owned by a pair of second generation adventurers. We have awakened evil, strange singing, blood cults, and more precious stones then you will know what to do with. Come to the Abandoned Mines for the treasure, stay for the Dragon God.

125119.description:
From the Introduction:

The Republic Army army book requires the Star Confrontation rulebook in order to play. This army book expands the base game by adding one additional army for players to select and use in play. Each army has its own special abilities that will make every game unique.

The Republic Army have highly skilled soldiers commanded by psionic soldiers known as Masters. When these forces work together they become a deadly fighting force that is near impossible to stop!
125119.name: Star Confrontations: Republic Army

125120.name: Kansas City in-a-box

647.name: Late for the Sky Production Company

125120.description:
This is a Monopoly clone from Late from the Sky, a publisher that specializes in themed Monopoly games. All the deeds, spaces on the board and cards feature locations and landmarks from Kansas City.

Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. When a player collects all the properties in one color group, the properties can be improved by first building skylines, and then upgrading to keys to the city. When players land on a space owned by another player they must pay rent. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.

647.name: Late for the Sky Production Company

125134.name: U.S.C.opoly

647.name: Late for the Sky Production Company

125134.description:

Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.

125136.name: Gunman Clive
125136.description:
User Summary

Gunman Clive, created by Bertil Horberg, is a side-scrolling shooter game set in the Old West. The mayor's daughter has been kidnapped and Gunman Clive is tasked with rescuing her. Clive must fight off her bandit captors and the local wildlife (wolves, bats, and... ducks) while traversing dangerous landscapes.

Gunman Clive features a unique weathered-paper artstyle, classic platforming action, and a sense of humor that never takes itself too seriously. It also includes many nods to classic videogames such as the disappearing block puzzles from Mega Man and the minecart levels from Donkey Kong Country.

125137.description:
The game
The aim of the game is to become rich. To do that, as merchant, the player should pay attention in selling, to do intelligent loans of money and wise investments.
The player represents a young merchant which should demonstrate all his ability to become the richest merchant of Venice.

How to play
The game is dividet into four turns. Each turn is divided into four round.
The first round concerns the travel organization in Venice, after the auction sale of the rights to be in command of each "muda". The players then must play to load the ships.
The second round concerns the selling of the goods that they are loaded. The goods must be sell in the same order as they were loaded.
In the third round the player can buy products in Oltremare and in the final step return to Venice. Here the players can sell their products or store them in their warehouses. The aim to store goods is to load them next turn, to sell them in another destination more profitable.

I'm looking for interested publishers for printing
125137.name: Venetiae

125138.name: The Tricolore's Shadow
125138.description:
From the publisher's web site:
The players are hired to perform a simple survey mission; however, the presence of a downed French satellite, trigger-happy militia, and the machinations of governments at the highest level will ensure this mission turns out to be anything but simple. Fleeing for safety, the players will have to avoid the governments of Beta Canum-4 as they try to get off-world.

125139.name: Terror's Lair
125139.description:
From the publishers web site:

You, American Marshal Obadiah Thomas, have been assigned to capture Felix Berthold. When the Ann Arbor arrived at Earth’s orbital station, all passengers going on to Tirane transferred to the New Orleans, another passenger liner. You have joined them undercover as a nanoelectronics parts salesman. The New Orleans will be in Earth orbit for only another six hours, finishing the discharge of its stutterwarp drives. You have been tasked with determining which of the passengers is your target and arresting him – without endangering the safety of other passengers before the ship leaves Earth and takes him to sanctuary at Tirane.

Terror's Lair is a solo adventure that does nto require a referee.

125140.name: The House of Azrán
125140.description:
From Introduction:

This web enhancement for The Complete Guide to Drow (Revised) is an example of a detailed drow household, constructed according to the book’s guidelines.

House Azrán is a drow family with deep roots and shallow standing. The house symbol is a stylized spider crawling downward beneath a steep triangular mountain, a reference to the house’s origins: it claims a direct descent from the high priestess of the ben’docian, the alpine elves whose defeat in the Kindred Wars ultimately spawned the drow. But the mighty have fallen. House Azrán’s current status is quite low, thanks to the inept diplomacy of the present matriarch.

125141.name: The Complete Guide to Liches (Revised)
125141.description:
From Introduction:

No creature is more feared than the lich, for the lich embodies the very essence of malign magic. Powered by phylacteries that are literally vessels of evil, liches live for thousands of years until their decaying physical forms finally crumble - and even, some live on. Their centuries-long horizon line gives them ample time to study, plot, and plan, and their devilish schemes are often generations in the making. No other creature possesses the same potential for long-term influence, nor does any other creature have the time to study dark magics for so long.

The Complete Guide to Liches covers all aspect of lichdom, from the most evil of undead lords to the rare redeemed liches, who have sloughed off their undead lives of evil. It introduces new lich variations, such as the philolich: a mortal lover reanimated by her lich companion to keep him company as he whiles away his centuries. The "typical" lich is examined in detail, along with several new varieties, including the monstrously powerful drowlich and the time-challenged novalich (whose more limited creation rituals give him but one year to complete a specific task). Finally, there are new feats and prestige classes to make lich NPCs even more deadly.

The Complete Guide to Liches is a stand-alone, world-neutral sourcebook covering everything you ever wanted to know about liches, both as a player and GM. This 3.5 edition completely updates the original version, and brings this sold-out sourcebook back into your hands!

125142.name: Off with his Head!
125142.description:
"Off with his Head!" is a part of the "Tudor - Life in Times of Treason & Treachery" history kit which includes:
- History book
- Board game and dice
- Stickers
- Mini felt pens
- Colouring activity
- Press-out ship

Is it your unlucky day? Are you on the way to the block on Tower Green? Or will you be the one to get a Royal Pardon? Take it in turns to roll one dice, and obey the instructions on the board. When you get towards the end, you must roll the exact number to finish on 100. So if, for example, you're on square 97 and throw a 5, you go forward 3 spaces to 100, then 2 back and land on 98. When you throw the exact number, you've finished. The last (!) person to reach square 100 gets the Royal Pardon and wins!

125143.name: Swordigo
125143.description:
Run, jump and fight your way through a vast world to defeat the spreading corruption. Explore a magical realm of dungeons, towns, treasures and devious monsters. Find powerful weapons, items and spells to defeat your enemies.

Source: The Developer Website.

125144.name: Arcana's Defender
125144.description:
Arcana’s Defender is a light, charming, and frantic adventure of magic and mayhem. Cast spells and summons to stop the oncoming hordes from taking Princess Arcana back to the Evil Litch Lord’s tower!Arcana’s Defender utilizes simple one touch controls and combines elements of strategic defense games and arcade style shooters to bring fast-paced action and strategic game play to your iPhone or iPod Touch.

Play they way YOU want with 3 difficulty settings and a variety of spells and upgrades. From casual to hard core, there is a little something for everyone.

You’ll be ‘pew pewing’ your little heart out!

Source: The Game Website.

125145.description:
Colonial Space Wars (CSW) is a tactical game based on a futuristic universe of science fiction that recreates battles between two or more armies. Each army is composed of square game pieces measuring 1.2 x 1.2 inches which represent their units.

During the game, pieces move across a rectangular board divided into squares arranged in rows and columns. In a game of CSW, each player has a number of units in his army which is set depending on the faction they are playing. We call this set of units a “Combat Sword. Two basic Combat Swords (Union of Terra and Alpha Centauri Brotherhood) are available for an introductory game of CSW.

Game pieces represent the units, troops, and vehicles of a fighting force. The pieces have two sides, Front (Illustration and Health arrow) and Back (Name, Attributes and Skills). A player has some pieces with the skill Leader (X). While these pieces are on the board, they grant X command points at the beginning of each turn. Each side alternates turns, making one or more moves depending on the number of Command points available.

Each unit requires a number of command points to be used that turn; this is referred to as “Activating ” the unit. When all command points are spent, the opponent’s turn begins. Each unit, upon being activated, can move and act in any order. The possible actions are “Move”, “Embark/disembark”, “Attack” and “Use active skills”. A typical game is a Sudden Death match, where the winner is the player that eliminates the ir opponent’s ability to activate units.
125145.name: Colonial Space Wars

125146.description:
This is a Scrabble like math game where you use your tiles to form valid math equations. Players follow basic order of operations when playing their equations. The first player to play all of their tiles wins and is declared the "Math Whiz".

Integrates with:

Fracul8
125146.name: Mathul8

125147.name: The Complete Guide to Wererats (Revised)
125147.description:
From Introduction:

Imagine a race of lycanthropes so devious, so cunning, and so insidious that they conquer entire kingdoms without ever being seen. These are the wererats. Their secretive broods infiltrate key posts in the government, military, and guilds, ensuring political protection from their enemies. When fighting can't be avoided, the mystic Council of the Flesh unleashes its horrific cross-bred monsters, which never give a hint as to their wererat origins. When nothing else works, the hard-hearted Weavers spread filth and disease, eliminating entire cities with a single contaminated breath. Kingdoms fall, power changes hands, and the enemies of the wererats are exterminated, without a single outsider ever knowing how.

Written by Eberron creator Keith Baker, this 3.5-edition book is a stand-alone, world-neutral sourcebook covering everything you ever wanted to know about wererats. It includes:

Detailed background material on wererat broods and their insidious plans, including social structure, cultural habits, and combat tactics.
Details on the secretive Council of the Flesh and their lycanthropic madness, including stats for the horrible creatures they have created.
New feats, classes, and skills for wererats and other shapechangers.
This special 3.5 edition includes all the freebies originally released as online supplements.




The Complete Guide to Wererats can be inserted easily into any fantasy setting.

176393.name: Lap Dance Kickstarter Stretch Rewards and 5th Player Expansion

125148.description:
The boss just fired the manager of his most prestigious strip club and is now looking for a new manager.

In Lap Dance, players take the role of entertainment assistants at that strip club. Their job is to take care of valued customers and see to their needs. Those wealthy customers will be asking for dancers, drinks and luxury services and will be paying good money to the assistant that fulfills their wishes. The player who will generate the most money by satisfying customer demands will become the new manager.

Sleeve sizes:
Euro Sized 59x91mm
Dixit Sized 80x120mm
125148.name: Lap Dance

125150.name: Round of Golf
125150.description: A golf boardgame containing 9 courses. The courses are stylistic rather than realistic in their portrayal, containing colored fields and numbered circles. The players use two ordinary six sided dice and move their markers to circles with numbers that are the same as the sum of their throw. The distribution of the numbered circles is made so that bad shots are less likely to occur (ie. bunker, ruff etc.) than shots to fairway. Putting is made using a special dice. Every hole has a small rule set that makes unusual events possible, such as hole in one etc.

193148.name: The Gallerist: KS Stretch Goal Pack #2

boardgamehonor.34502: 2015 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork/Presentation Nominee

125153.description:
This age of art and capitalism has created a need for a new occupation - The Gallerist.

Combining the elements of an Art dealer, museum curator, and Artists’ manager, you are about to take on that job! You will promote and nurture Artists; buy, display, and sell their Art; and build and exert your international reputation. As a result, you will achieve the respect needed to draw visitors to your Gallery from all over the world.

There's a lot of work to be done, but don't worry, you can hire assistants to help you achieve your goals. Build your fortune by running the most lucrative Gallery and secure your reputation as a world-class Gallerist!

Maximize your money and thus win the game by:

having visitors in your gallery;
exhibiting and selling works of art;
investing in artists’ promotion to increase art value;
achieving trends and reputation as well as curator and dealer goals.
125153.name: The Gallerist

125154.description:
The first expansion for "I Signori dei Draghi":
Hordes of angry Dragons crowd Mysthras again after a long exile.
Countless creatures, new powers and new magical artifacts make your challenges even more exciting.
In addition to a new role strongly related to dragons, make their appearance on Mysthras creatures of "Lx" level and "allies" that will shape and make each game more strategic.
The Dragons are back in Mysthras. You will be able to control their powers?

The game box includes:
- 52 cards
- 2 instruction cards
125154.name: I Signori dei Draghi: I Segreti di Mysthras

125155.name: Playtime Game
125155.description: From the rules: This is a most interesting and instructive game. As many children can play as there are individual playing cards. Give each player a card and place all the filler pieces in the center of the table face down. The object of the game is to complete cards correctly. Players draw from the face down fillers and try to complete a figure. If he/she does so the player draws another filler card and tries to add it properly. He continues to pick fillers until he draws a filler card that does not belong on his card. When that happens he/she returns the filler card face down into the center. After having mixed it with the rest of the remaining filler cards play continues in turn until someone completes their card and wins the game,

125156.name: Game of Bible Objects
125156.description:
Game has 105 cards, each bearing a picture of some object connected with the Bible or Bible times and in most cases one or more Bible references. Shuffle the cards and deal 10 cards to each player. Each player tries to make books. Three cards of the same class of subjets make up a book. These completed books are placed aside till the end of the game when they are counted. Whoever has the most books wins.

Each player calls any player he wishes and asks for a card from any series - (Animals, Trees etc.) If successful then the player may continue asking for other cards from any player he wants until he asks for a card from a player and that player does not have one that he asked for, at which time the active player draws 3 cards from the deck and play passes to the next player to his left.

Game #4012

125157.name: Football (TI-99)
125157.description:
Game Manual

Exciting color action and fun for 2 players. You pick the plays, call the defense, snap the ball. The computer actually simulates the game based on professional football statistics! Every game is different and challenging.

125158.name: Crazy Rabbit
125158.description:
You're Robin Rabbit, and you believe Lock the rabbit boss is hogging all the carrots! Fight your way through the horrible hedgehogs, rebellious rabbits, and other enemies to reach the end of the course. Collect as many golden carrots as you can for maximum score. Take carrots from the rich...and share them with the poor!

Source: The Publisher Website.

125159.name: Elements & Magic
125159.description:
You are the human king, owner of several castles, but evil orcs seek to take them from you. Defend your castles alongside your army! Secure your defenses and channel the elements to unleash an ancient power upon your enemies. In the meantime, don't forget to farm and mine for supplies!

Source: The Developer Website.

125160.name: Elf Archer
125160.description:
Join Saeel's quest to rescue the elf princess from hordes of hideous orcs. Rescue your elf princess and bring her home!

Source: The Publisher Website.

125161.name: Monkey Bomber
125161.description:
There's more than one way to fry a chicken...
Blast away all chickens to pass each level.

How to Play: Mouse = Aim & Drop Bombs

Source: The Publisher Website.

125162.name: Alice & Nix's Adventure
125162.description:
Find a way out of each level. Hearts replenish life and mirrors let you pass through barriers. Watch out for the bouncy red lights—they aren't friendly!

Source: The Publisher Website.

125163.name: Navy Glory
125163.description:
The Allies have defeated the Blue Army across all battlefronts and victory is within your grasp. However the Blue Army have pushed out a last ditch attempt to cripple your warship as it returns to base. It's up to you to defend yourself as you set sail for home.

Use the mouse to aim your cannons, left click to shoot.

Source: The Publisher Website.

125164.name: Uphill Farmer
125164.description:
Pick up cash for points, and make it to the finish line as quickly as you can without falling over!

Up/Down = Accelerate/Reverse
Left/Right = Lean Back/Forward
Space = Jump

Source: The Publisher Website.

125165.name: Wave Jumper
125165.description:
Set your height and your speed to make your wave jumper fly as far as he can! That's all there is to it!

Source: The Developer Website.

125166.name: Fly Guy
125166.description:
Fly like a bird over the rooftops and see how far you can go. Click the left mouse button to take off!

Finding the right balance between speed and power is vital to succeed. The longer you run the less you can fly in the air, if the green bar is filled to max then you can no longer flap your arms.

Source: The Publisher Website.

125167.name: Jones Platformer
125167.description:
A hard platformer! Jump, run, slide, climb walls, push boxes, collect coins, and more!

Source: The Developer Website.

125168.name: Cell Defense
125168.description:
Tom always eat unhealty food. As his immune system you must kill the bacteria go into his body! Time to fire, Commander!

Build up the immune system along the cell walls in order to destroy the bacteria before it makes Tom sick.

Source: The Developer Website.

125169.name: HaxBall
125169.description:
HaxBall is a free to play flash game available at http://www.haxball.com. The game has a community of players organised into local, national and international leagues.

From the website:
What is HaxBall? HaxBall is a realtime multiplayer game that plays like a mix between football and air-hockey, and it's a real blast. Best matches are 2-vs-2 or 3-vs-3, but there's no limit to how many can join.

Source: The Publisher Website.

125170.name: Biotech Vehicles
125170.description:
Science fiction is full of biotech vehicles, from the whale subs of East of Eden to the living ships of Vorlons and Shadows in TV’s Babylon 5. 2300AD for Mongoose Traveller also features the heavy use of biotechnology by the alien Pentapod race, including vehicles and starships.

Since the Traveller vehicle design rules found in Supplement 5-6: Vehicle Handbook are effects-based, they can be used to design biotech vehicles in addition to standard ‘hard’ vehicles.

This book, allows you to do just that.

125171.name: Knock Knock Who's There?
125171.description:
Contents:
104 cards (4 sets of 26 cards)
rules

Includes rules for three separate games.

Game #1: The "Grab it quick" game
The Knock Knock cards are shuffled and placed in a draw pile, while the Who's There cards are placed face up on the table. A player says "Knock Knock", the other players respond, "Who's there?" and then all players race to find the correct card from those face up on the table. The person who grabs it first keeps both cards, and the person with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

Game #2: Advanced grab it
Same as Game #1, except the Who's There cards are placed face down, adding a memory element.

Game #3: The "Remember Where" game
Instead of a draw pile, each player is dealt 4 Knock Knock cards, and on their turn must match a Knock Knock card to the Who's There cards which are face down on the table. If a player makes a match, they keep the cards and get a second turn. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

125172.name: Empress of the Deep: The Darkest Secret
125172.description:
User Summary

Empress of the Deep is a hidden object adventure game developed by Silverback and published by Big Fish Games. The game tells the story of Anna, and underwater princess who must save her realm from Pandora, her power-mad twin sister.

125173.name: Empress of the Deep 2: Song of the Blue Whale
125173.description:
User Summary

Empress of the Deep 2: Song of the Blue Whale follows Empress Anna after the events of the first game. Pandora has destroyed the Ark and cursed the Sky City, and Anna must travel there to heal the animal guardians and save the Children of Spring, Summer, Winter, and Fall.

125174.name: Carcassonne (2010 / Mobile)
125174.description:
User Summary

This is an iOS implementation of the boardgame "Carcassonne". Up to 5 players can play hotseat on a single device, and there are 9 different AI opponents, each with unique playstyles.

125175.name: Game of Fire Department
125175.description: Game consist of 4 pieces representing fire department apparatus and a spining dial. The movment of the various pieces of apparatur to the location of the fire is beset with many obstacles such as traffic jams, open drawbridges over which they must pass, railroad crossing with gates down, detours, engine and tire troubles and collisions which must be overcome. The oject of the game is to see which player best moves his piece of apparatus to the location of the fire, go into action, limber up his piece, put out the fire and then return to his fire house returning to their station by exact count on the spinner,

125178.name: Rock Band Drums
125178.description:
User Summary

Drum controler to Rock Band games.

125179.description:
Mix between Trivia game and Top Trumps

The 32 trump cards are mixed. Each player receives 16 cards in front of them. The target goal is set in the middle of the table.
The first player draws his top card and choose one of the four category, reads it and its value. The enemy reads value of same category. The higher value wins. The losing player ask the question from the card. Winner of the duel can answer the question and wins if he answer correctly. Otherwise he loses to opponent.
Some cards are with word "target goal", then the duel winner may shoot the goal.
After 16 duels the player who now has fewer cards takes "the end of the game" card and puts it behind his stack of cards.
Duels continues until this card.
The winner is the player who has more trump cards in his hand.
125179.name: Der Wilde Wissens-Trumpf

125180.name: Tetris Battle Gaiden
125180.description:
User Summary

Tetris Battle Gaiden is a competitive puzzle battle game. Players match off against an opponent (human or computer) in a number of stages. There is also Rensa Mode, which increase the speed of drops creating a more challenging game.

125184.name: Breakout (2000)
125184.description:
User Summary

Breakout is a remake of the original arcade game of the same name. It has the same basic gameplay in which the player controls a paddle and attempts to deflect a bouncing ball into bricks. This re-imagining introduces 3D graphics, new interactive elements, powerups, and multiplayer modes. Additional control options are also offered: the shape and angle of the paddle can be changed to provide more control over the movement of the ball.

Breakout features a basic story in which Bouncer the paddle must defeat the evil Batnix in order to rescue his girlfriend Daisy. Numerous enemies such as chickens, knights, and aliens stand in his way.

125185.name: Rollcage Stage II
125185.description:
User Summary

Rollcage Stage II is a futuristic racing game in which racers compete on gravity-defying tracks. It is a sequel to Rollcage featuring many new tracks and cars.

The game's defining feature are cars that are able to traverse almost any surface if they have attained a sufficient speed, even on walls and ceilings.

125186.name: Motocross Mania
125186.description:
From the back of the case to the North American PlayStation edition

"Motocross Mania brings you throttle-twisting fun with tons of racing and freestyle action. Realistic environments and high performance bikes let you ride everything from big supercross double jumps to huge outdoor gaps. The riding only gets better as you progress through the game and unlock different bikes and tracks, adding to your bag of big air tricks.

Perform sick aerial tricks off huge jumps!

Fast-paced arcade gameplay.

Win championships to earn money and upgrade your bike components!

Three styles of brutal competitive action - Motocross, Supercross, and Freestyle."

125187.name: Battle This!
125187.description: BATTLE THIS! is the ultimate two players (Ages 12 to Adult) strategic board game for those who are looking for a challenge. The game consists of two military forces; Green and Brown. Each force has a total of 16 playing pieces: 8 Soldiers, 4 Tanks and 4 Fighter Planes. Each playing pieces move and capture a certain way and each playing pieces are worth a certain amount of points. The objective of the game is to try to outwit your opponent; eliminate all of his / her playing pieces while trying to score as many points as you can.

136742.name: Imperium Chronicles: Fleets at War – Claws of Chaos

125188.description:
The Game
Fleets at War! is a tactical wargame played on the floor or a large table with cardboard counters representing starships, fighters, and other space craft, set in the same universe as the Imperium Chronicles Role Playing Game.
The wargame consists of three major factions: the Imperium, the Magna Supremacy, and the Pirate Clans.

The IMP System
Fleets at War! uses the IMP System that reduces the number of die rolls necessary during play. All other calculations are done by referencing a chart of two opposing attributes (ex. Damage vs. Armor) to find a result. The goal of this system is to speed up play and allow for large-scale battles.

Game Scale
Each counter in the game represents a single starship or a flight of four to five fighters. An inch equals approximately 0.2 miles, or a mile equals 5 inches. Each game turn equals roughly 2 to 3 minutes.

Stat Cards
Each class of ship (i.e.: heavy cruiser, destroyer, frigate, etc.) has a one- or two-sided card listing all the stats for that class, including its offensive and defensive capabilities.
125188.name: Imperium Chronicles: Fleets at War!

125189.name: Paperclip Railways: Boardgame Guru
125189.description:
Promo station card for Paperclip Railways. The base game has three 'placeholder' station cards that can be cashed in for a promo of choice 'from the box'.

This Promo card was given to customers of Boardgameguru, a UK board game store

125190.name: Paperclip Railways: London on Board
125190.description:
Promo station card for Paperclip Railways. The base game has three 'placeholder' station cards that can be cashed in for a promo of choice 'from the box'.

This Promo card was given to players at the London on Board games club.

125191.name: Brave: The Video Game
125191.description:
Inspired by "Brave," the Disney/Pixar animated fantasy adventure movie, the video game invites players to run, jump, and battle their way through the rugged landscape of mythical and mysterious Scotland. By using their wits and bravery, gamers will also be able to wield a sword and bow to defeat fierce enemies, break a magical curse and save a kingdom.

Features

- Uncover Secrets and break a Magical Curse.
- Battle fierce enemies with your sword, bow and arrow.
- Jump, dodge and climb through rugged environments.
- Hear the voice of Merida as you play the game.
- Discover new characters and costumes inspired by the film.

Source: The Game Website.

125193.name: Il Gioco Gigante dell'Italia
125193.description:
The game consists of two phases. In the first phase, a players assemble a large (100 cm x 70 cm) jigsaw puzzle map of Italy. In the second phase, players roll numbered and colored dice to place their tokens on cities and to place the special tiles representing the special landmarks of the regional capitals.

Players seek to place all of their tokens on cities and to place all of the regional capitals from their hands on to the board. The numbered die indicates the quantity of tokens that may be placed, while the colored die indicates who may play tokens or place a regional capital tile.

The first player to place all of her tokens and regional capital tiles wins the game.

125194.name: Il Gioco Maxi dell'Italia
125194.description:
Players first assemble the large jigsaw puzzle game board then roll and move to take a tour of Italy.

Each turn, players roll a die and advance along a marked route from the starting point at Rome. Landing on a red spot ends the turn; landing on a green spot allows the player to advance two extra cities; landing on a yellow spot causes a player to go back one city.

The winner is the first player to complete the entire tour route and return to Rome by exact die roll.

125195.name: Forest opoly

647.name: Late for the Sky Production Company

125195.description:
Forest opoly is a version of Monopoly published by Late for the Sky, a company that specializes in Monopoly clones. All the spaces, deeds, and cards have facts about wild animals on them.

Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. When a player collects all the properties in one color group, the properties can be improved by building. When players land on a space owned by another player they must pay rent. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.

125196.name: Penguin opoly

647.name: Late for the Sky Production Company

125196.description:
This is a Monopoly clone from Late from the Sky, a publisher that specializes in themed Monopoly games. All the deeds, spaces on the board and cards are penguin themed and some have penguin facts on them.

Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. When a player collects all the properties in one color group, the properties can be improved by building. When players land on a space owned by another player they must pay rent. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.

125197.name: French Bulldog opoly

647.name: Late for the Sky Production Company

125197.description:
This is a Monopoly clone from Late from the Sky, a publisher that specializes in themed Monopoly games. All the deeds, spaces on the board and cards feature the French Bulldog.

Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. When a player collects all the properties in one color group, the properties can be improved by building. When players land on a space owned by another player they must pay rent. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.

125199.name: Jack Russell-opoly

647.name: Late for the Sky Production Company

125199.description:
This is a Monopoly clone from Late from the Sky, a publisher that specializes in themed Monopoly games. All the deeds, spaces on the board and cards feature the Jack Russell terrier dog.

Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. When a player collects all the properties in one color group, the properties can be improved by building. When players land on a space owned by another player they must pay rent. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.

125201.name: Snowman opoly

647.name: Late for the Sky Production Company

125201.description:
This is a Monopoly clone from Late from the Sky, a publisher that specializes in themed Monopoly games. All the deeds, spaces on the board and cards feature snowman humor or helpful hits for building snow creations.

Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. When a player collects all the properties in one color group, the properties can be improved by building. When players land on a space owned by another player they must pay rent. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.

125202.name: Noun Bite
125202.description:
It is a new card game that 2 or more people compete to spell most number of words using the most number of cards. It is unique that anyone can capture ('Bite') others' words by creating new ones from the spelled ones at any time, which makes the game fast pace and fun.

The person who has the most vocabulary may not necessarily win because smart use of special cards can turn the tide very quickly.

125203.name: Commando Quarterly (Volume 2, Issue 1 - Spring 3068)
125203.description:
From the table of contents:

Editor’s Corner, Departments, WorldBook, Tactical Analysis: Heavy ‘Mechs, An Unlikely Place, Simulator Tech: Assessment, News From The Front, Simulator Tech: Brainstorm, Simulator Tech: Scenario #1, Simulator Tech: Scenario #2, Simulator Tech: Scenario #3, Simulator Tech: Scenario #4, Simulator Tech: Nais Answers, Commando Painting Gallery

125204.name: Commando Quarterly (Volume 2, Issue 2 - Summer 3068)
125204.description:
From the table of contents:

Editor’s Corner, Letters To The Editor, Departments, WorldBook, Tactical Analysis: B.A., There Were Two, Crafty commando: DropShip, News From The Front, Simulator Tech: Small Tech, The Banshee’s Lair

125205.name: Battle of Kawagoe: Hojo Ujiyasu's gamble
125205.description:
Operational level wargame of the Kawagoe battle during the Warring States Period (戦国時代 Sengoku jidai) in Japan. The Kawagoe battle is one of three major surprise attack in Japanese History.

Players control either Hojo clan or Allied force of Uesugi clan and Ashikaga Shogunate. Each player manage command allocation, movement and combat. Both force has different characteristics. Hojo clan has small size but trained powerfull units. They also has special activation chit for Hojo Tsunasige. He was commander of Kawagoe castle and made he made effective sortie in this battle. Allied force has large units more than Hojo clan but their command control was inefficient because their armies was patchwork from many clans.

Winner determined by special sudden-death condition or victory point. Victory point earn by elimination of opponent units and condition of Kawagoe Castle.

125206.name: Battle of Itsukushima, 1554-1555
125206.description:
Campaign level wargame for the battle of Itsukushima. The battle of Itsukushima is one of three major surprise attack in Japanese history.

Player control either Mouri clan or Sue clan. Each player manage movement, combat and negotiation with minor lords. Each counter represent lord and their soldiers. Some lords may change the loyalty to another side. In this part, Mouri clan has the advantage by their intelligence capability.

Winner determined by control of provinces.

125207.name: Monogamy: An Intimate Kit of Sensual Essentials

boardgameversion.166759: Monogamy  An Initmate Kit of Sensual Essentials

125207.description: Expansion for Monogamy including 25 additional game cards and various accessories including a bullet, ties, spanker, feather.

125208.name: Aliens (1986)

videogamecompilation.229038: Five Star Games III (C64 / Spectrum / Amstrad)

125208.description:
User Summary

An action game that closely follows the events of the 1986 movie. The player controls a group of Colonial Marines sent to investigate the colony on LV-426. As the game progresses, the goal changes to survival. Success is measured by the number of marines left at the end of the game. Scenes and dialogue from the movie add to the immersion.

The game consists of 6 completely different stages (almost mini-games).
Stage 1: Dropship Landing- a flight sim style sequence, where you follow the correct flight path to safely land the dropship
Stage 2: Return to the APC - a side scroller/maze shoot'em up, where you have the opportunity to save 4 of the Marines that didn't make it in the movie
Stage 3: Operations Room Defense - an up/down action sequence like Tapper (or Stampede), where you keep the Aliens away from your marines with flame throwers
Stage 4: Air Duct Escape - a maze sequence, where grenades can be used by trapped Marines to buy some time for your escape
Stage 5: Rescue Newt - action similar to stage 2; use your motion tracker to locate Newt and make your way to the ship.
Stage 6: Alien Queen Battle - a 1st person view, boxing style fight to the death, using the Power Loader Exo-Suit

Not to be confused with the Software Studios release of the same year. That was a static FPS style game.

125209.name: Crystal Quest
125209.description:
Crystal Quest is an action computer game for the Apple Macintosh and Apple IIgs. It was written by Patrick Buckland for Casady & Greene in 1987, and was ported to the IIgs in 1989 by Bill Heineman. Ports were also made to the Amiga, Nintendo Game Boy, iPhone OS, and Palm. It was notable both for its fast-paced gameplay and for being the first game to support the color displays on the Macintosh II.

The game was based on the original shareware version, Crystal Raider, one of the supporters of which had been Michael Greene, founder of Greene Inc (later to merge with CasadyWare to become Casady & Greene). A sequel, similar to the original game, Crystal Crazy, was created some years later.

Source: Wikipedia, "Crystal Quest", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

125210.name: Heroes Against Darkness
125210.description:
[Quoted from the Product Overview: http://heroesagainstdarkness.blogspot.com/p/heroes-against-d...]

Heroes Against Darkness is a free, fast, flexible, and fully-featured fantasy d20 RPG system. The game is quick to learn and play, while offering progressively greater options and flexibility as players develop their characters and explore the breadth and depth of the system.

For Players:
• A game that’s fast, fun and deep
• Streamlined rules system using unified mechanics
• Eleven character classes for all play-styles
• Three martial classes: Warrior, barbarian, berserker
• Two specialist classes: Rogue, hunter
• One hybrid class that combines magic and martial: Hospiter
• Five magi classes: Warlock, healer, canonate, necromancer, mystic
• Extensive character background and skill options
• Fast character building with plenty of depth
• Martial and specialist classes get meaningful combat choices through class-specific techniques that are based on trade-offs and the unique capabilities of each class
• Anima points-based magic system with five main schools focusing on each of the following; physical, healing, protection, necrotic and controlling

For GMs:
• A system that’s easy for the GM to set up and run
• Intuitive and clear rules
• Set up unique combat encounters in minutes
• Easy on-the-fly conversion of adventures from other systems
• A simple ability test system for non-combat challenges
• Support for long-term campaign play
• Extensive GM’s Guide to help run the game
• Huge bestiary with over 80 monsters
• A framework for quickly making custom monsters
• A comprehensive world-building guide
• Appendix of key tables for GMs

125211.name: Sons of the Sea
125211.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Web Enhancement for Black Sails Over Freeport originally appeared in the EN World Player's Journal and is presented courtesy of our friends at Goodman Games. In it you can read about Harrimast and Yarash, the pirate gods of Freeport.

125212.name: Christmas Special
125212.description:
From the Introduction:

Although winter hardly ever burdens these environs with more than a handspan of snow it has this small town firmly in its grip for some time now. Still none of the citizens feel like complaining. Quite to the contrary for them this time of the year is reason enough for celebrations.

The town's small square has been festively decorated. The conifer tree growing at its center has been hung with colorful glass spheres and its tip has been decorated with a gilded star. Light ropes have been put up between the square's gas lamps and hung with small lanterns to provide additional light for the celebrations during this dark time of the year.

Parcels wrapped in colorful paper and ribbons have been arranged around the tree. Usually each one contains something useful for every household of the neighborhood. At the perimeter a number of tables have been set up, bottles of heavily spiced wine spread across them waiting to be heated and consumed to further increase the festive mood.

125213.name: Construction Site
125213.description:
From the Introduction:

An empty lot measuring approximately one hundred and fifty by two hundred and ten feet has been recently walled in in this neighborhood. A ten foot height wooden fence surrounds the lot almost completely. Only a single gate has been left open, barely wide enough to let the heavy machines used inside pass through.

Inside the construction is still in an early stage. A large and deep pit has been excavated, the excavator used still at the site. The walls of this pit, which will soon be occupied by a solid foundation for the building under construction, have been fortified with sheet piling retaining walls and additional steel beams.

125214.name: Gas Station
125214.description:
From the Introduction:

Situated at the street side are the three gas pumps of this full service gas station. A wide lane to either side of these pumps allows the attendants to service up to six cars at once while street vendors might sell beverages or snacks to the customers. No structures that might disturb the scenic landscape have been erected here and non are necessary given the weather is usually sunny and calm. Only a number of palms have been planted around the gas station to provide a bit of shade.

125215.name: Crossroads
125215.description:
From the Introduction:

Autumn has descended on the land. A fact that becomes especially visible in places dotted with broad-leaved trees like this spot where a number of gravel paved paths meet. The leaves of the trees flanking the roads have turned a hundred shades of yellow and orange in the past few days and it wont be long now until the trees shrug of their foliage entirely.

Three small roads meet in this place. Old and weathered wooden signs indicating where each of them leads. At the center of the crossroads a circle of soft ground has been set aside from the roads by stones just high enough to provide somewhat comfortable seats and an especially tall tree grows at the circles center to provide this resting spot with shades during the hot days of summer.

125216.name: Road in the Woods
125216.description:
From the Introduction:

A narrow dirt road winds through this quite forest. The ruts worn deeply into the dirt of the road speak of the regular traffic of carts and coaches it sees. Young spruce grow moderately dense to either side of the road their branches hanging low. Interspersed with them small shrubs grow, almost hugging the ground. Still enough light reaches the ground to allow grass and flowers to cover most of the ground between the trees.

125217.name: Beach 3
125217.description:
From the Introduction:

A narrow strip of sandy beach as it could be found on the shore of many a sea or large lake. The sand of the beach extends far into the shallow water on the one side and is separated from the road following the shoreline by a narrow strip of grass and palm trees on the other. Beach towels, umbrellas, life guards and sand castles are not the only things that can be found at the beach. At respectable distances you might find small beach bars like this one. During daytime swimmers and sunbathers alike will find refreshments here, but it is not until the sun sets that this small lantern lit establishment comes alive with music and patrons enjoying their beverages.

125218.name: Beach 2
125218.description:
From the Introduction:

A narrow strip of sandy beach as it could be found on the shore of many a sea or large lake. The sand of the beach extends far into the shallow water on the one side and is separated from the road following the shoreline by a narrow strip of grass and palm trees on the other. Large beach towels and umbrellas are not the only things dotting the beach. At times you might also find a more or less elaborate sand castle and the tools used to build them. And of course you will come across high seats manned by a lifeguards, keeping watch over the beach and the revellers enjoying their leisure time here, in regular intervals.

125219.name: Leagues of Adventure

rpghonor.21802: 2012 UK Games Expo Best Role-playing Game Nominee

125219.description:
From the book:

Leagues of Adventure is a roleplaying game set in the late Victorian Age, a gritty steampunk game where the hostile natives are a serious threat, a pulp action game where the characters eat savage warriors for breakfast, a highly cinematic one which allows the characters to swing single-handedly from the underside of an early airship while bare-knuckle boxing pterodactyls over a lost plateau.

Truth be told, it’s whatever you want it to be!

Whatever drives your character, there’s a world packed with
danger, excitement, and mystery out there waiting to be explored!

Welcome to a world of Victorian Globetrotting adventure in an age of exploration!

Leagues of Adventure is a Steampunk Victorian Adventure Roleplaying game from Triple Ace Games.

This book contains the complete Ubiquity Rules allowing you to pick up and play immediately!

Microbadges
Leagues of Adventure fan - Globe
Leagues of Adventure fan - Initials

125220.name: Beach 1
125220.description:
From the Introduction:

A narrow strip of sandy beach as it could be found on the shore of many a sea or large lake. The sand of the beach extends far into the shallow water on the one side and is separated from the road following the shoreline by a narrow strip of grass and palm trees on the other. While large red white beach umbrellas providing shade and large beach towels dominate much of the beach its border to the street sports large trash cans in regular intervals to encourage people to keep the beach clean.

125221.name: Desert Temple
125221.description:
From the Introduction:

Here a massive structure rises from the sand covering the land from horizon to horizon. Massive blocks of sandstone form this temples foundation and the stone slabs making up its door frames are no less impressive. Most of its walls though have been constructed from much smaller stone blocks and the hollow space between inner and outer walls has been filled with sand and gravel. The temples only gate to the outside, set in the massive front wall rising to a height of almost 60 feet, is curiously open. Anyone with business at the temple is admitted into the first courtyard, where they are tended by the priests in the shade of the partial roof and the columns supporting them.

The inner courtyard though is separated from the first one by another impressive wall with an equally impressive gate of hard wood and brass. Columns supporting a partial stone roof provide shade for the priests and attendants resting here. Yet another massive gate leads into, what anyone not knowing better must take for the temples sanctuary.

As a matter of fact this windowless room only lit by two lanterns is only an anteroom for the actual sanctuary and the priests' quarters below ground where they are isolated from the blazing heat of the day by a thick layer of sand. A wide ramp leads down to a gate of stone without any apparent means of opening where only the initiates of the temple are admitted.

125222.name: Astrolabium
125222.description:
From the Introduction:

Hidden deep underground lies this mystical astrolabium, channelling arcane energies to simulate the celestial bodies moving across the skies far above in astonishing detail. Three massive crystal lenses that can be rotated in every direction on a metal frame focus the arcane energies flooding through the room into its centre to manifest them as models of celestial bodies. The rooms floor is wrought of finely polished marble. And lecterns of root wood, polished to a sheen, surround the magical aperture dominating the room. A single doorway breaks the spherical wall of the room which is plated in metal to prevent disruptions from the outside.

125223.name: Enclosure at the Zoo
125223.description:
From the Introduction:

A simple enclosure, measuring roughly 60 by 65 feet, like many others next to it on either side. This enclosure was not designed to provide the natural habitat of the animals kept within, but to showcase said beasts to the spectators. Still the fence is high, and the columns in which it is anchored are massive, to provide the audience with at least a feeling of safety, even if it could be rightly doubted that fence or gate could hold back the beasts within. A second much lower fence surrounding the enclosure is supposed to keep people out of reach from some of the animals that might be kept in these enclosures.

125224.name: Elevated Railway
125224.description:
From the Introduction:

In other places a subway tunnel might have been dug for this line, but here the groundwater level is too high and the ground itself too soft. Thus the line was built as a much cheaper elevated railway. The numerous wide arches of this viaduct distributing the weight of the structure and the trains traversing on it. In addition streets can easily cross through any number of arches. Still most of the arches were boarded up and rented out as storage space or workshops.

125225.name: Canyon
125225.description:
From the Introduction:

Over the centuries wind and water have worn a narrow canyon, widening and narrowing on occasion, into the stone making up most of the local landscape. Nowadays the flow of the water follows other paths leaving this canyon, like most of the environs bone dry. Only some kind of large, almost spherical cactus has managed to prosper on the mostly bare rock, possibly providing sustenance if you manage to get past the spines. But maybe you should beware either whatever insects or other animals these cacti lure in with their large flowers or the cacti's lure of food and water itself.

125226.name: Open Mining Pit
125226.description:
From the Introduction:

Pits like this one dot much of the local landscape as the rock below the thin layers of earth and other materials is rich in iron due to long ago volcanic activity. Ever since this was discovered industrious people have been performing open pit mining in an ever growing scale.
